p: The extracts were obtained in a crystalline form ( Figure 1a). The color of the extracts varied from white ( B. sacra) and yellow ( B. frereana Birdw.) to light brown ( B. neglecta). To preserve all ingredients including pentacyclic triterpenic acids ( Figure 1b), the extraction was carried out at room temperature. In previous studies, we have shown that methanol is a very efficient solvent for the extraction of frankincense [ 10]. It ensures optimal solubility of the extracts and is, therefore, used in sample analysis. To investigate, how many extraction cycles are necessary for an exhaustive extraction, three samples were extracted up to six times, each in triplicates. The experiment showed that the first three extraction cycles have an extraction efficiency of 99.6% ( Figure 2a). Moreover, 99.95% of the available PTA were extracted within the first three extraction cycles ( Figure 2b).
